thread.title: Former Arsenal and England star Jay Bothroyd to return to Far East after stunning spell in Japan
thread.title_full: Former Arsenal and England star Jay Bothroyd to return to Far East after stunning spell in Japan

author: dcutts
title: Former Arsenal and England star Jay Bothroyd to return to Far East after stunning spell in Japan
text:
JAY TRAINS EAST Former Arsenal and England star Jay Bothroyd to return to Far East after stunning spell in Japan 
The 34-year-old striker was a huge hit in the J League with Jubilo Iwata By Daniel Cutts Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments EX-ARSENAL and England star Jay Bothroyd has agreed a deal to return to the Far East this summer. 
The 34-year-old striker was a huge hit in the J League with Jubilo Iwata and is set for another spell. Getty Images 3 Jay Bothroyd has agreed a deal to return to the Far East 
The former QPR ace has agreed a pre-contract on July 1 after becoming one of Asia’s hottest forwards ever. 
He had a successful two-years in Japan, scoring a staggering 35 goals in 54 matches. Getty Images The 34-year-old striker was a huge hit in the J League with Jubilo Iwata MOST READ IN SPORT REAL PAIGE-TURNEr WWE leaked sex tape saga hots up as MORE raunchy videos and pics of ex-champ Paige are shared online sealing the deal Jose Mourinho pictured in Croatia as he bids to get £35million Ivan Perisic deal over the line ULTIMATE FLASHING CHAMPIONSHIP UFC ring girl Arianny Celeste goes TOPLESS on the beach as she soaks up sun in Mexico Coleman career fear WARNING GRAPHIC: Seamus Coleman's leg broken by Neil Taylor horror tackle as Wales defender sent off in draw with Ireland UniTeD MOVE LIKE GRIEZ LIGHTNIN' Man Utd close in on Antoine Griezmann with move said to be a formality X-RATED SHOCKER Paige sex tape bombshell as fans express outrage at 'sex act over WWE championship belt' BIG COMEBACK Ex-heavyweight champ Tyson Fury back in training for first time since meltdown... and he looks bigger than ever A FINE MESS Lionel Messi 'facing ban after hurling abuse at officials' following Argentina's 1-0 win over Chile 
Bothroyd has had several offers from J League sides, but has not committed to where he will be playing. 
He had to return to England last year due to personal issues, but has been keen on a return for some time, according to the Mirror . Getty Images The former QPR ace has agreed a pre-contract on July 1 Bothroyd: I'm ready for England 
The once-capped Three Lions man started his career at Arsenal before spells with Cardiff, Coventry, Charlton and Italian club Perugia. 
Bothroyd has had twelve clubs throughout his career, but had his best stint in England with Cardiff.
